meanings.sent1: The task was delegable to others, so I didn't have to do it alone.
meanings.sent2: The delegable project was easily shared among team members.
meanings.sent3: It's like having a magic wand that makes any job delegable!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so bright, it seemed delegable to light up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time zones makes the idea of delegable responsibilities clear.

meanings.definition: Able to be assigned to another person.
meanings.sent1: The extra work was delegable to the new intern.
meanings.sent2: The delegable duties were evenly distributed among the staff.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his love for pizza was delegable to his best friend.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was so delegable, it spread to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the complex math problem seem delegable to even the youngest student.

meanings.sent1: The ticket was delegable to a friend who wanted to attend the concert.
meanings.sent2: The delegable membership allowed access to multiple locations.
meanings.sent3: His passion for music was so delegable, it inspired others to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent4: The warmth of the campfire was so delegable, it felt like a cozy blanket wrapping around us.
meanings.sent5: The idea of kindness is easily delegable from one person to another.
